decks.notes: This Jund Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, disruption through hand disruption spells, and efficient removal spells to control the board. Utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six, along with strong creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, the deck aims to pressure opponents quickly while disrupting their game plan. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana access, along with graveyard hate in the form of Nihil Spellbomb. This deck excels at applying pressure early and maintaining control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on powerful, efficient creatures paired with disruptive spells to control the opponent's resources while applying pressure. By utilizing cards like Tarmogoyf, Wrenn and Six, and Liliana of the Veil, the deck aims to quickly close out the game while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards such as Inquisition of Kozilek and Assassin's Trophy. With a mix of removal, disruption, and threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through aggressive plays and resource management.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a variety of spells like Supreme Verdict, Opt, Path to Exile, Cryptic Command, and other control cards to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to gain card advantage and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes Snapcaster Mage to flashback key spells and maintain board control. The mana base is designed to consistently cast the deck's spells and utilize different colors for flexibility in answers.

The main strategy of this Modern Aggro - Humans deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful tribal synergy. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, as well as Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to disrupt the opponent's spells, this deck aims to build a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. With a focus on cards that boost each other's power and resilience, such as Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish, this deck capitalizes on the strength of its human creatures to secure victory.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on assembling the Urza Tron lands to accelerate out powerful Eldrazi creatures. It utilizes cards like Expedition Map and Karn, the Great Creator to find and utilize key pieces of the Tron lands quickly. Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust help disrupt opponent's game plans, while Ugin, the Ineffable provides additional board control. The Eldrazi creatures, such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, bring the pressure and close out the game quickly with their powerful abilities and high power levels.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine, allowing you to bring them back from the graveyard for powerful combos. Cards like Hedron Crab and Stitcher's Supplier help to mill your own cards, while Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis can be cast for free using the graveyard. Faithless Looting and Lightning Axe provide additional card draw and removal, making it easier to set up your graveyard combos. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and powerful graveyard-based strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix, while also utilizing cards like Thing in the Ice and Aria of Flame to pressure the opponent. It incorporates card draw and manipulation to consistently find the necessary pieces to win quickly, with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Finale of Promise to help close out games. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and direct damage, making it a powerful and fast-paced Aggro deck in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo with Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek to generate a large number of flying tokens, along with utilizing Urza, Lord High Artificer for mana acceleration and card advantage. The deck also includes various control elements such as Whir of Invention, Ensnaring Bridge, and Ghirapur Aether Grid to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck utilizes artifact synergy with cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to ensure consistency and efficiency in executing its game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly establish a board state of creatures with hexproof and then enhance them with auras to create an unstoppable force. The deck focuses on using creatures like Gladecover Scout and Slippery Bogle, which cannot be targeted by opponent spells or abilities, as the backbone of its aggressive strategy. A variety of auras such as Daybreak Coronet, Ethereal Armor, and Rancor are used to both boost the power and toughness of these creatures and provide additional benefits. The deck also includes protection spells like Hyena Umbra and Spirit Mantle to further enhance the hexproof creatures' survivability.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through low-cost burn and efficient creatures. By utilizing cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike along with aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game before they can stabilize. Eidolon of the Great Revel helps punish opponents for casting spells while Boros Charm provides versatility and reach. The deck aims to win by dealing consistent damage and overwhelming the opponent before they can mount a defense.

The deck focuses on utilizing +1/+1 counters and modular mechanics to quickly amass a formidable board of creatures, with emphasis on synergies between cards like Hardened Scales, Walking Ballista, Arcbound Ravager, and Animation Module. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful interactions, allowing for explosive starts and high damage potential. By maximizing the benefit of +1/+1 counters and modular abilities, the deck can quickly build a threatening board presence and apply pressure on opponents, leading to fast wins and consistent aggression.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells like Faithless Looting, Manamorphose, and Thought Scour to bring out Arclight Phoenix for fast and aggressive attacks. Aria of Flame provides additional burn damage while Thing in the Ice helps control the board. The deck also includes spells like Lightning Bolt and Surgical Extraction for removal and disruption. Finale of Promise allows for powerful spell recursion, giving the deck flexibility and resilience. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient spells and quick creature recursion.

The deck is focused on playing aggressive creatures like Arclight Phoenix, Monastery Swiftspear, and Soul-Scar Mage to deal damage quickly. The spells in the deck, such as Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Lava Dart, help to clear the way for the creatures to attack. Faithless Looting and Light Up the Stage provide card draw and help to find key pieces of the deck. Bedlam Reveler can be a game-ending threat once the graveyard is filled with spells. Overall, the deck aims to win the game by overwhelming the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and burn spells.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Allosaurus Combo by using cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to cheat out powerful creatures like Allosaurus Rider and Autochthon Wurm. These creatures can then be sacrificed to gain life with Nourishing Shoal or draw cards with Griselbrand, setting up a combo win condition. The deck also includes Chancellor of the Tangle to provide additional ramp and disruption, along with various cards to help dig through the deck and protect the combo.

Utilizing the Urza lands to quickly ramp up to powerful threats like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, the deck focuses on control through board wipes like Oblivion Stone and graveyard hate with Relic of Progenitus. Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying help to search for specific lands or threats, while Chromatic Sphere and Chromatic Star provide color fixing. The inclusion of creatures like Thragtusk, Wurmcoil Engine, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger provide additional threats and life gain to stabilize the board. The deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful late-game plays.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using artifacts and abilities to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value and creating a win condition with the Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek combo. By utilizing cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to manipulate the battlefield and slow down the opponent's game plan. With access to a variety of versatile artifacts and control options, the deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through strategic plays and resource management.
